 Project Github
    +
    Smart Walking Stick

    Description

    Smart Walking Stick is a final year capstone project for Computer Engineering student in University of Ottawa. The idea came when I realized the difficulties faced by impaired vision people in their daily life when they only depend on the old single featured of walking stick. I was thinking that the walking stick can be improvise by adding some latest technology features to improved the user experience and aid the impaired vision people. Along with 3 other teammates who agreed with this idea as a Capstone project, we worked on this project for a year.

    Technical

    Some main features that was implemented on the walking stick such as SOS Emergency notifier, obstacles detector and Indoor Navigation System (INS). As we knew, Global Positioning System (GPS) does not work inside building which caused any navigation application such as Google Maps, Apple Maps and etc will not work inside building. Thus, we decided to implement our own INS using RFID technology and some algorithm.

    What I did

    I was responsible for back-end and front-end development. For the back-end, I setup, managed and monitor AWS for the API request. I wrote API using NodeJS for best route finding API and also implemented Djikstra's Algorithm to improve the efficiency for the computation

    For the front-end, my teammates and I developed an Android application for the user and implemented a voice recognition feature where it allows the user to use the application by giving out command with just one tap
